discoveries.finding: SDXL Motion Module beta released
discoveries.details: Can produce 1024x1024 16 frame videos, implemented into Comfy within hours by Kosinkadink

discoveries.finding: Motion Scale control for fine-tuned motion
discoveries.details: Allows tuning up and down the amount of motion in output, combined with Motion LoRAs will provide extremely high degree of control

discoveries.finding: SD2.1 CLIP encoding can influence SVD videos
discoveries.details: Can use SD2.1 CLIP encoding to influence Stable Video Diffusion output

discoveries.finding: LCM LoRAs with AnimateDiff enable ultra-fast vid2vid
discoveries.details: Processed 2,467 frames in just 81 minutes with good quality results using LCM LoRAs with AnimateDiff multi-controlnet workflow

discoveries.finding: Text to OpenPose skeleton generation
discoveries.details: Workflow that takes text and outputs Openpose skeletons, can be combined with vid2vid for complex motion more reliable than diffusion video models

discoveries.finding: IPAdapter batch processing with unfold option
discoveries.details: Allows IPAdapter to process batches with Animatediff, unlocking many new possibilities

discoveries.finding: Controlnet timestep scheduling
discoveries.details: Allows determining which part of sampling process a controlnet should influence, helps fix weird artifacts

discoveries.finding: FreeInit and Noise Layers added to Comfy
discoveries.details: New capabilities added for improved video generation control

discoveries.finding: Sample Settings improvements in Comfy
discoveries.details: Enhanced sampling control options added

discoveries.finding: FaceID Portrait Models integrated
discoveries.details: Improved resemblance for portrait generation in various styles

discoveries.finding: Pseudo outline trick for better guidance
discoveries.details: Getting outline of subject instead of line drawings to avoid picking up too much detail on faces/costumes

discoveries.finding: Unsampling + RGB Video2Video workflow
discoveries.details: Process involving unsampling and SparseRGB for smooth video2video transformation with scarily good results

discoveries.finding: Motion LoRAs can guide motion with a range of precision from soft to hard
discoveries.details: Unlike vid2vid which tends to guide with hard precision, Motion LoRAs allow you to provide input videos and make motion 'a little bit like that' in combination with other inputs, giving more direction than highly specific guidance

discoveries.finding: Motion LoRAs can stabilize animations and fix artifacts
discoveries.details: Can be used to fix/avoid artifacts in generations by providing good examples at low guidance, such as fixing normal realistic running

discoveries.finding: Tiled IP Adapter works better on non-square images
discoveries.details: Solution to IP adapter issues with wider generations losing detail and causing artifacts, though still experimental

discoveries.finding: IPA Tiling provides higher resolution view by breaking input image into components
discoveries.details: Breaks up input image into multiple components and feeds them in one-by-one so IPA has far higher resolution view, works in batches/with masks

discoveries.finding: IPA Style Transfer for SDXL implemented
discoveries.details: Matteo added style transfer capability for SDXL models

discoveries.finding: Depth maps can adjust movement layers for different motion levels
discoveries.details: Superbeast's workflow uses depth maps to adjust movement so different layers have different levels of motion

discoveries.finding: Motion transplanting possible with MotionThief node
discoveries.details: Allows transplanting motion from one video onto AD generation

discoveries.finding: Style transfer implemented for SD1.5
discoveries.details: Can be used in Animatediff flows to fix style in particular place for consistent animations

discoveries.finding: Value scheduling for IPA strength
discoveries.details: Schedule animations for IPAs without masks, making it faster and less resource intensive

discoveries.finding: Motion Thief can use videos to control motion
discoveries.details: Videos can be used as motion control sources

discoveries.finding: Steerable Motion 1.4 supports unlimited frames
discoveries.details: Can now do unlimited frames thanks to Matt30's improvements

discoveries.finding: Spline editor adds major UX improvements to Comfy
discoveries.details: Allows for many new possibilities in workflow creation

discoveries.finding: CameraCtrl enables granular camera motion control
discoveries.details: Adds ability to control camera motion granularly in generations

discoveries.finding: Audioreactive dancing workflow
discoveries.details: Building on previous work, adds audio-reactive capabilities to dancing videos with potential for audio-reactive passes on generated videos

discoveries.finding: Vid2Vid upsampling achieves high consistency
discoveries.details: Achieves extremely high-consistency and close to no context issues even on HotShot

discoveries.finding: LivePortrait mapping approach for character expressions
discoveries.details: Mapping expressions onto video feels like a WAY better and more dynamic approach than portrait animation for story-telling

discoveries.finding: Higher resolution Clip Vision using tiling
discoveries.details: Tiling Clip Vision to help it see images at higher resolution, catching additional detail and adding coherence to animations

discoveries.finding: Cross Window Consistency improvements
discoveries.details: Implementing NaiveReuse and ContextRef and other context shift improving methods into ADE

discoveries.finding: CogVideoX vid2vid interprets motion rather than copying exact structure
discoveries.details: Rather than copying the exact structure, it interprets the motion from input videos

discoveries.finding: CogVideoX supports multi-phase prompts
discoveries.details: Can handle complex prompts with scene transitions like 'Scene 1: A blonde female... Transition: A zoom out... Scene 2: A new female...'

discoveries.finding: CogVideo img2vid can render complex reasonably long motion from input images
discoveries.details: Using image inputs seems to elevate the amount of detail the model can render

discoveries.finding: CogVideoX can coherently interpret highly imprecise instruction
discoveries.details: Model can understand what's in gaps with subtle guidance

discoveries.finding: CogVideoX can track lips and faces with pose control
discoveries.details: Face pose controls characters very loosely, can track lip movements

discoveries.finding: Motion drawing now available for CogVideoX via Tora
discoveries.details: Motion drawing working in Comfy with 16GB VRAM

discoveries.finding: Moshi optimized by 16x to run on local GPUs
discoveries.details: Originally required 4x h100s, now runs on local GPUs within 2 days of release

discoveries.finding: LoRA Training for HunYuan works with only images
discoveries.details: Incredibly quick training, very good adherence to subjects, works flexibly in different contexts while retaining details like tattoos

discoveries.finding: Warped Noise technique for guiding video generation
discoveries.details: Netflix released technique, integrated into Comfy by Kijai, works with Cog and AnimateDiff

discoveries.finding: HunYuan can run on just 12GB VRAM
discoveries.details: Workflow shared that enables playing with Hunyuan with only 12GB VRAM

discoveries.finding: HunYuan can generate high quality in 10-15 steps
discoveries.details: Fast generation with good quality results

discoveries.finding: Camera motion control for LTXV
discoveries.details: Technique allows guiding LTXV generations with specific camera motions using different trajectories on same input

discoveries.finding: LTXV 0.9.5 combines excellent control with speed
discoveries.details: Probably the best control of any modern open video model while being incredibly fast at 3600 frames/min

discoveries.finding: Context window shifting works well with Wan 14b
discoveries.details: Shows really nice results with barely noticeable shifts, combining approaches from AnimateDiff ecosystem

discoveries.finding: Reward LoRA for Hunyuan improves prompt adherence
discoveries.details: Very positive impact on prompt adherence - prompt mentioning 'walking' shows much better adherence with the LoRA

discoveries.finding: Sonic can make very expressive speaking from audio input
discoveries.details: Can even do dogs, available in ComfyUI

discoveries.finding: Wan Control LoRAs can be trained on any condition with input/output video pairs
discoveries.details: Can be used for deblurring, inpainting by training on videos with segments removed, interpolating, drawing trajectories based on optical flow, interpreting hand signals and body movements as motion

discoveries.finding: LTXV 13b is particularly excellent for LoRAs
discoveries.details: Model feels amazing for LoRAs with fast training times, can accomplish high quality results in 60-90 minute training runs

discoveries.finding: Video LoRAs can create content that looks completely unlike closed models
discoveries.details: Hard to distinguish as AI, can combine multiple LoRAs together for unique effects

discoveries.finding: VACE enables Hollywood-level face-swapping in ComfyUI
discoveries.details: Users achieving professional quality face swaps and costume changes with VACE

discoveries.finding: ATI provides finally good motion trajectory control
discoveries.details: ATI released offering trajectory control that feels natural and responsive for video generation

discoveries.finding: Normalized Attention Guidance works on distilled models
discoveries.details: New negative prompting approach that works on distilled models, breaks Flux out of its typical style

discoveries.finding: Clownshark achieved next-level style transfer with HiDream while reducing VRAM by 4GB
discoveries.details: Style/structure transfer without assistant models, achieving MJ sref level versatility

discoveries.finding: 4-step distillation method for Wan
discoveries.details: ModelTC team launched LightX2V - a 4-step distillation method for Wan

discoveries.finding: VACE masking technique unlocked
discoveries.details: Magic VACE masking that allows for precise object manipulation and effects

discoveries.finding: Smooth continuations without color distortion achieved
discoveries.details: Finally figured out how to get smooth continuations w/o colour distortion from Wan/VACE

discoveries.finding: Dynamic complete object removal without shadows
discoveries.details: Technique for removing objects completely from video without leaving shadow artifacts

discoveries.finding: Wan upscaling comparable to Topaz
discoveries.details: Open source upscaler that feels at least as good as the new Topaz upscaler while being infinitely configurable and extendable

discoveries.finding: WanAnimate can track facial features very well and even do pupils
discoveries.details: Out of the box it works well for single character animations and can bring static images to life with just 10 steps

discoveries.finding: VitPose with WanAnimate can do animal animations
discoveries.details: Successfully demonstrated with quadruped animals like dogs and hippos

discoveries.finding: QwenImage 2509 can interpret multi-image inputs and controlnets very impressively
discoveries.details: New version shows significant improvements in multi-image processing capabilities

discoveries.finding: Pusa integration shows promise for video extensions
discoveries.details: Kijai shared integration with example workflow showing good results for video continuations

discoveries.finding: LoRA trained on Animatediff outputs produces unique motion style
discoveries.details: LoRA trained on Animatediff outputs allows for Wan-level motion and image adherence together with distinctly Animatediff-y movement

discoveries.finding: Low strength LoRA application brings subtle motion enhancement
discoveries.details: Using the Animatediff LoRA at low strengths brings a subtly Animatediff-y burst of motion to things, works well at just 6 steps

discoveries.finding: VACE masking degradation can be eliminated
discoveries.details: Latent noise hijinks can eliminate the VACE masking degradation, allowing seamless placement of old man into any video

discoveries.finding: Context transitions enable scene transformations with subject consistency
discoveries.details: Using context transitions allows doing scene transformations while keeping the subject consistent

discoveries.finding: Wan Move represents significant improvement over AI
discoveries.details: Wan Move looks impressive and feels like a huge step-up from AI, works even for abstract and irrational content

discoveries.finding: Water morphing LoRA trained efficiently
discoveries.details: LoRA for water morphing effects trained on just 6 videos for 1,000 steps

discoveries.finding: LTX-1 LoRAs work with LTX-2
discoveries.details: LTX-1 loras all seem to work with LTX-2, and 62 LoRAs from LTX 0.97 were tested to validate compatibility

discoveries.finding: LTX-2 supports multiple types of conditioning at launch
discoveries.details: LTX2 can do multiple kinds of conditioning on launch including pose control

discoveries.finding: LTX-2 inpainting appears undetectable
discoveries.details: LTX-2 inpainting capability seems almost undetectable in quality

discoveries.finding: LTX-2 runs efficiently on RTX 3090
discoveries.details: LTX-2 can run on a 3090 GPU with impressive results

discoveries.finding: Flux Klein models show impressive outpainting/colorization
discoveries.details: New Flux Kleins are quite impressive for relatively small size - 4b can do outpainting/colorisation in seconds

discoveries.finding: IC-LoRA approach for LTX2 control mechanisms
discoveries.details: LTX released a IC-LoRA approach for training control mechanisms for LTX2, including luminance map references for lighting control

troubleshooting.problem: A1111 extension is broken and various repos have loads of issues
troubleshooting.solution: Kosinkadink is working on fixing ComfyUI extension and applying learnings to fix A1111

troubleshooting.problem: Background tends to be very chaotic - jumping all over the place with the main subjects in AD
troubleshooting.solution: This problem is solvable with fine-tuning - train a model on data with steady backgrounds

troubleshooting.problem: DragNUWA can't reveal hidden secrets in artworks
troubleshooting.solution: Acknowledged limitation - technique doesn't understand object nature well enough

troubleshooting.problem: DragNUWA frequently doesn't understand object nature
troubleshooting.solution: Results in weird transformations - known limitation to be aware of
Rebalance setup around v3 rather than avoiding it - Connor suggests adapting workflows

troubleshooting.problem: Live Comfy AD link broken with v3
troubleshooting.solution: Use specific HuggingFace tree link as alternative

troubleshooting.problem: IP adapters trained at low resolution and only square images cause detail loss and artifacts on wider generations
troubleshooting.solution: Use tiled IP adapter to work better on non-square images (experimental)

troubleshooting.problem: ComfyUI_LLMVISION nodes had a security exploit
troubleshooting.solution: There are instructions on how to deal with it in a Reddit post

troubleshooting.problem: Tooncrafter can be inflexible and breaks easily, especially with characters in in-between movements
troubleshooting.solution: No specific solution provided, noted as a limitation
Workflow for getting Flux running with 12GB VRAM

troubleshooting.problem: CogVideoX fragmented ecosystem with different LoRAs/CNs for different versions
troubleshooting.solution: Could likely be fixed with IPA for unconventional styles
Could likely be controlled with an IPA

troubleshooting.problem: LTXV breaks down frequently and is overly sensitive to prompting
troubleshooting.solution: Use RF Inversion with the img2Vid model for better vid2vid results
Custom node for managing Comfy environments with tutorial

troubleshooting.problem: WanAnimate doesn't do multicharacter animations out of the box
troubleshooting.solution: This is a known limitation that hasn't been solved yet
Low VRAM VACE 2.1 workflow that works with under 8GB VRAM

troubleshooting.problem: Motion speed issues with distilled Wan
troubleshooting.solution: Using Animatediff LoRA helps solve motion speed problems with distilled Wan

comparisons.verdict: Equivalent level of progress can be achieved with AD through fine-tuning
AD is improving but Pika started from higher base and is improving at fast pace

SVD delivers more impressive base outputs especially for 3D motion, but AD's modular approach and ecosystem makes it better for fine-grained control, vid2vid, and creative interpolation. Best used together for different strengths
DragNUWA feels like a better version with more control
v3 probably is the best now, requires setup rebalancing but worth adapting to
Community workflows replicate $39/month Magnific functionality for free
Small step up but still suffers from inconsistency and degradation throughout frames
Warpfusion clip holds up well in comparison
Sora incredibly impressive but AD overwhelmingly better for precise motion control due to community work
DynamiCrafter surpasses SVD in terms of quality/dynamism and is promptable, but struggles outside anime/realistic styles and lacks ecosystem
DynamiCrafter won't see AnimateDiff level of improvement due to limited extensibility and ecosystem
Maybe a juiced-up SD1.5 is all we need
Has good, realistic motion but may not be great for extending
Lower resolution/detail than main closed-source models, but has impressive base motion when it works
CogVideoX motion is promptable unlike AD, but doesn't plug into existing SD1.5 ecosystem
Flux Video will almost certainly beat Cog on metrics, but unknown if better for practical creative tasks

comparisons.comparison: Open models vs Sora and closed models
comparisons.verdict: Expects Sora to destroy open models on head-to-head basis, but believes open source innovation will make them more creatively empowering - similar to how AnimateDiff vs Pika Labs played out

comparisons.comparison: Current AI video vs a year ago
comparisons.verdict: Massive improvement - comparing current AnimateDiff results with similar work from a year ago shows dramatic progress
Hunyuan is better model head-to-head but CogVideoX feels best for control
Wan(x) beats Sora on VBench rankings despite being 14b variant
There probably won't be a meaningful gap between open and closed models in 2025 - open models will have considerably more control

comparisons.comparison: Wan vs other models for specific tasks
comparisons.verdict: Wan takes 5+ mins to run, likely only best for tasks requiring cohesive motion, other models better for specific tasks
LTXV is overwhelmingly faster than Wan and other models, particularly excellent for LoRAs
Cloud 4090 costs 20x less than Luma for similar quality, also better quality

comparisons.comparison: VRGameDevGirl's Wan Megamerge vs main Wan model
comparisons.verdict: Megamerge combines multiple detailer and speed LoRAs, produces beautiful results
Test comparison shown by David Snow
Wan VACE described as superior for revisiting pieces
Qwen shows superior training results

comparisons.comparison: WanAnimate vs other face animation models
comparisons.verdict: Finally competitive with high-end solutions, can do pupils and detailed facial tracking
WanAnimate and VACE are to art what Sora is to slop - they offer the level of control needed for admirable artwork

comparisons.comparison: New subject LoRA vs Nano + Seedream
comparisons.verdict: Works significantly better than Nano + Seedream for subject + style when paired with InStyle LoRA
Interesting comparisons shared showing differences between Z-Image (left) and Flux (right) in results
Comparisons done between version 1 and version 2 of the Animatediff LoRA

comparisons.comparison: SCAIL vs Wan Animate vs other vid2vid approaches
comparisons.verdict: Wan Animate feels so different to SCAIL and other more linear vid2vid approaches

comparisons.comparison: Animatediff LoRA trained for both Wan and LTXV
comparisons.verdict: Interesting differences between the two models when using same LoRA

tips.tip: Fine-tuning will be key to unlocking AD
tips.context: Similar to SD1.5 ecosystem evolution

tips.tip: Pair music with art you share
tips.context: Makes content feel more alive and impactful

tips.tip: Use motion scale to control amount of motion
tips.context: When you need to increase or decrease motion in videos like dogs playing poker

tips.tip: Combine different AI tools for enhanced results
tips.context: Use LLM for poem generation, then prompts for prompt travel, then AD for video, then voice gen for narration

tips.tip: Use attention masking with IPAdapter for better character consistency
tips.context: When doing video transformations and maintaining coherent characters

tips.tip: Share experimental findings when playing with new models
tips.context: Helps others understand capabilities and enables further development

tips.tip: Focus on specific domains and go deep
tips.context: Better results than trying to do everything - HarrowLogo's logo work as example

tips.tip: Reduce friction for frontier explorers
tips.context: Create workflows that help others get started with new techniques

tips.tip: Push styles and vibes to the max
tips.context: High-effort art that pushes techniques to limits inspires mini-art movements

tips.tip: Use multiple Motion LoRAs with LoRA masking for different effects throughout video
tips.context: Queue multiple LoRAs throughout generation using Kosinkadink's LoRA masking for 'LoRA travel'

tips.tip: Build an army of Motion LoRAs for shared repository
tips.context: Anyone can add LoRAs to shared repository with description, HuggingFace link, and example video

tips.tip: IPA plays very nicely with motion loras for powerful steering
tips.context: When using workflows like Purz Context Smashing or Steerable Motion

tips.tip: IPA tiling will likely allow you to increase resolution using existing realistic upscale methods while retaining style
tips.context: For video upscaling applications

tips.tip: Share workflows and learnings openly to help ecosystem thrive
tips.context: When exploring and building on top of new technologies

tips.tip: Browse through the channel and take time to appreciate the work of others to keep ego in check
tips.context: Making art tends to be a very egotistical pursuit

tips.tip: Don't do competitions just for the prizes - do it to push yourself to see how good you can make something
tips.context: Motivation for entering competitions

tips.tip: Create for yourself and not the algo
tips.context: General creative advice for artists

tips.tip: Use archival footage approach to mask model limitations
tips.context: For compelling storytelling when working with AI video models

tips.tip: Use image inputs with CogVideoX to elevate detail quality
tips.context: When working with CogVideo img2vid implementation

tips.tip: Flux Block LoRA selector helps understand what different LoRA layers are doing
tips.context: For targeting generations better

tips.tip: Use AnimateDiff as upscaler for CogVideoX when rendering at low sizes
tips.context: Works nicely for improving CogVideoX output

tips.tip: Combine multiple control methods for precise AI video control
tips.context: Key to driving AI video with precision, currently have IPA and CN that can be combined

tips.tip: Combining multiple control methods is key to deep creative control
tips.context: When using video generation models like Mochi or CogVideoX

tips.tip: Share workflows that are useful to others to help them start from a higher point and push even further
tips.context: When developing new model workflows

tips.tip: Use director personas for style prompting
tips.context: When using LTXV - dramatically changes shot characteristics

tips.tip: Use refined settings for HunYuan upsampling
tips.context: Will be even better once Hunyuan CNs are available

tips.tip: Motion LoRAs can create unique artistic capabilities
tips.context: Training LoRAs for distinct motion styles and characteristics from source material

tips.tip: Specific artistic capabilities and user experience matter more than raw model power
tips.context: How good the artistic experience is and predictability/usefulness for creative process

tips.tip: Control models and workflows will be extremely important
tips.context: For unlocking specific capabilities since txt2vid and img2vid are very limited from control perspective

tips.tip: Control LoRAs can potentially stack for AD-level control
tips.context: Though it's an open question how well they stack

tips.tip: Video LoRAs have extraordinary potential for both unique styles and consistent styles of motion
tips.context: For creating cinematic content

tips.tip: Use Shift+Esc to mark all spam channels as read
tips.context: When dealing with Discord spam

tips.tip: React with openmuse emoji to push art to OpenMuse
tips.context: Contributing art you're proud of to the community gallery

tips.tip: Use continuation nodes and workflows to avoid discoloration
tips.context: When working with Wan+

tips.tip: Combining models (Multitalk + MAGREF + Uni3c) to achieve impressive results no single model can do
tips.context: Reminiscent of Stable Diffusion/Animatediff days approach

tips.tip: Creating anchor images + animating them with edit models for creative exploration
tips.context: Using edit models for creative workflows

tips.tip: Use upscaling individual images then vid2vid for better results
tips.context: Approach common in AnimateDiff days, now applicable to Wan with excellent results

tips.tip: Combine context windows and prompts for video continuations
tips.context: Can achieve impressive results without complex workflows

tips.tip: Use sliding context windows for long video generation
tips.context: Can render 2000 frames of InfiniteTalk in just 12 minutes

tips.tip: Use lower LoRA strengths for subtle motion enhancement
tips.context: When wanting to add subtle Animatediff-y motion to content

tips.tip: Combine anchor images + Humo to add lipsync to i2v generations
tips.context: For adding lip sync functionality to image-to-video generations

tips.tip: Share your work to help the open source ecosystem
tips.context: People like LTX and Alibaba release models because they believe benefits of being open can outweigh downsides. Sharing work in channels, Twitter, Reddit helps continue this spirit

tips.tip: Use well chosen key frames for better results
tips.context: Extraordinary results can be accomplished with well chosen key frames

news.update: Banodoco community launched with focus on open source AI video/image generation
news.details: 3 main components: Steerable Motion, Img+Img2Vid models, Creative Assistant

news.update: Research product coming soon for building and animating videos key-frame by key-frame
news.details: Will run on local GPU or cloud

news.update: B34STW4RS released first version of repo for fine-tuning Animatediff
news.details: AD-Evo-Tuner - still early but functional

news.update: $8k in compute credits offered for experiments
news.details: For ideas too big or expensive for individual users

news.update: Kosinkadink shipped functional ComfyUI extension after days of work
news.details: Best place for technically-oriented people to experiment with AD

news.update: Monthly equity grants announced - 0.125% each to 8 contributors
news.details: Part of open-source native company building approach

news.update: Ceyuan Yang & Yuwei Guo released Motion LoRAs for Animatediff
news.details: Examples for camera movements but can be used for much more

news.update: HotshotXL released - AD-esque motion module trained on SDXL
news.details: Trained on 8 frames, made for short gifs
Theme: 'journeying', deadline Oct 22nd, winner gets 4.5kg Toblerone

news.update: SDXL Motion Module beta released by original AnimateDiff authors
news.details: Beta version available on HuggingFace, produces 1024x1024 16 frame videos
Deadline December 20th, theme 'an emotional journey', prize is giant Toblerone
1% equity split monthly among contributors for first 8.5 years, shared between people who ship things aligned with open source AI video goals
Vid2vid and Interpolation channels created for deep topic exploration
Video controlnets with RGB and Scribble variants - first video controlnets available
Latest version with improvements, integrated into Comfy within hours
New version of logo LoRA with logo video animation for SVD
Drag-based control for SVD generations, multiple community implementations
2 NVIDIA 4090s prize sponsored by Glif for creative masking and simple workflow categories
Combines IPA with Sparse Ctrl for better creative interpolation

news.update: Exponential ML released Motion LoRA trainer for AnimateDiff v3
news.details: Allows training MotionLora on single video in around 15 minutes for precise motion guidance

news.update: Kosinkadink released huge AnimateDiff ComfyUI 'gen2' update
news.details: Refactors for flexibility, includes scheduling motion model settings, FreeNoise support, View Options, non-looping context options, FreeInit support, multiple model support, improved Mac support
Small improvement over previous version but still has consistency and degradation issues

news.update: Kosinkadink opened GitHub and Patreon sponsorship pages
news.details: Community encouraged to support his infrastructure work that enables all workflows
Cerspense brought the legendary Zeroscope to Comfy with distinct and interesting motion style

news.update: Deforum launched their nodes on Comfy
news.details: Deforum nodes bring all that magic to Comfy, also launched Deforum Studio consumer product
New version allows for interpolation from starting image to ending image, Kijai implemented basic version into Comfy
More stable version ready for beta testers, built on top of Steerable Motion and various Comfy nodes
Kos implemented CN Reference into Comfy, previously only available in A1111
Others released paper featuring Matteo's style transfer work and made him coauthor

news.update: Art Sharing Wednesday converted to YouTube format
news.details: Now a weekly YouTube show up to 10 minutes featuring pieces shared throughout the week
ELLA took the nerd internet by storm and ntialML was quick with Comfy implementation
Workflow allows transforming faces and heads/hair while staying close to context

news.update: Midjourney.Man shared optimized version of VK's workflow
news.details: Iteration with bunch of optimizations

news.update: Banodoco company raising $1m funding at $10m valuation
news.details: First checks in bank, expect to close around end of month

news.update: Banodoco had first revenue of €224.94 from Doughbot testers
news.details: Plans to share profits as it becomes significant
Theme uses ComfyUI default images, deadline May 24th, prizes include giant Toblerone bars

news.update: Banodoco bounties granted to two recipients
news.details: One for training better versions of Animatediff and open source Story Diffusion, another for upgrading art sharing bot
Winners were 'Breaking free' by Brad, 'Alice In LaLaLand' by Material Rabbit, 'Chocolate Land', and 'Comfy Dreams' by Jas

news.update: Tooncrafter released as evolution of {x}_crafter line of interpolation models
news.details: Does impressive interpolation with realistic motion in-between frames, but based on 2.1 so limited other models available

news.update: Mobius SDXL-based fine-tune released on apache-2.0 license
news.details: Results are impressive especially in terms of variety of style possible

news.update: Dough 0.9.5 released, almost a good artistic tool
news.details: Both Dough and Steerable Motion are close to being a great artistic experience

news.update: Dough 0.9.8 released with new Inspiration Engine feature
news.details: Uses LLM + style transfer work to generate hundreds of potential input images to choose from. Pinokio integration coming soon

news.update: Banodoco equity sharing for May announced
news.details: Company shares 1% per month for first 7.5 years with ecosystem participants, sharing 100% of proceeds from ownership
Now stable and good artistic tool, featuring Steerable Motion with more workflows coming. Cheap version ($0.30/GPU hour) coming soon with 75% profit sharing with community
Big week for open source with Flux release, multiple community implementations and fine-tunes
Near-perfect image segmentation capabilities, nearly as big a deal as Flux
Coming close to training time #1 and looking for braintrust of people who've trained models before
Instruction-driven IP-Adapters that allow prompting IPA alongside image reference, includes first IP-Adapter for SD3 and working towards one for Flux
AI-toolkit now supports Flux1 training with tutorial from promptcrafted
Available using Kijai's Comfy nodes, shows promising base motion capabilities

news.update: Banodoco monthly update and equity announcement for August
news.details: Shared monthly community update

news.update: Motion I2V released 6 months post paper
news.details: Allows guiding AnimateDiff motion by drawing arrows, limited to 16 frames
Most coherent vid2vid transformations possible with open models today
Continuing quest to defeat AnimatedDiff context switching
Very promising for voice2voice capabilities

news.update: Moshi by Genmo released for local GPU
news.details: Optimized to run on local GPUs instead of requiring 4x h100s
Shipped by multiple contributors
Motion drawing now working in Comfy with 16GB VRAM
New version of CogVideoX with improved capabilities

news.update: Lighttricks open sourced LTXV video model
news.details: Speed is primary appeal, produces beautiful results when working well, but breaks down frequently. Full model on open license promised once fully trained

news.update: Huge AnimateDiff ComfyUI update by Kosinkadink

limitations.limitation: Background tends to be very chaotic in AD
limitations.details: Jumps all over the place with main subjects

limitations.limitation: A1111 extension is broken with loads of issues in various repos
limitations.details: Reduces friction for experimentation
Lacks 1.5-esque ecosystem, less certain it will experience improvements for fine-grained motion control like vid2vid and creative interpolation
Challenge is getting consistent movement and lowering degradation across generations
AnimateDiff often produces jittery faces that need post-processing with tools like FaceDetailer
Frequently doesn't understand object nature, resulting in weird transformations
Cannot reveal hidden secrets in artworks as demonstrated
Still difficult to control, motion can be jerky, color issues persist

limitations.limitation: SVD 1.1 still suffers from inconsistency and degradation throughout frames
limitations.details: Small improvement but core issues remain

limitations.limitation: DynamiCrafter struggles outside anime and realistic styles
limitations.details: Can be unpredictable generally and may not be very extensible, doesn't have ecosystem to build on
Has limited ecosystem of supporting models and tools
Current upscaling workflows have performance issues that need addressing

limitations.limitation: Tooncrafter can be inflexible and breaks easily, especially with characters in in-between movements
limitations.details: Based on 2.1 so limited other models like IP-Adapters available to control it
While impressive, still has imperfections in facial animation
Various models struggle with context consistency, though upsampling helps

limitations.limitation: CogVideoX may not be great for extending

limitations.limitation: CogVideoX can't yet do transformer morphs
limitations.details: Has issues with lack of guidance and motion breaking up

limitations.limitation: Driving motion with specificity is difficult
limitations.details: While it does good prompting, precise motion control is challenging

limitations.limitation: CogVideoX doesn't plug into existing ecosystem
limitations.details: Unlike AnimateDiff which could leverage SD1.5 ecosystem

limitations.limitation: CogVideoX deals with unconventional styles weirdly
limitations.details: Though could likely be fixed with IPA

limitations.limitation: LTXV breaks down frequently and is overly sensitive to prompting
limitations.details: Despite speed advantages, the model has reliability issues

limitations.limitation: Mochi lacks specific control despite impressive generation capabilities

limitations.limitation: Omnigen is very slow despite impressive results
limitations.details: Promising for image editing and combining elements but speed is a major limitation

limitations.limitation: txt2vid and img2vid have very limited control

limitations.limitation: Multitalk currently works for single subjects only
